metadata.titleEn: New insights of myosin heavy chain 10 as a potential biomarker of clinical atherosclerosis (2018-2022)
metadata.description: Data collection and analysis will be carried out from January 2018 to December 2022. MYH10, a key gene for atherosclerosis, will be obtained through DEGs screening, weighted gene co expression network analysis, construction and analysis of protein protein interaction network, function enrichment analysis and GSEA analysis Spearman and Pearson rho tests were used to compare the differences in intima-media thickness (IMT), MYH10, and α - SMA expression, and correlation analysis was performed. Using receiver operator characteristic (ROC) curve analysis to determine MYH10 and α- Sensitivity and specificity of SMA in predicting AS. Using Cubic Spline Interpolation Algorithm to Analyze MYH10 and α- SMA expression and the high-risk warning range of AS. Adopting Swiss model（ https://swissmodel.expasy.org/ ）Construct a α - SMA protein model. Using PyMol 2.3.4 software (DeLano Scientific LLC, https://pymol.org/2/ ）Dehydration and removal of receptor protein ligands. MGL Tools software (Molecular Graphics Laboratory, Scripps Institute, http://mgltools.scripps.edu/ ）Used to hydrogenate receptor proteins and calculate charge. Adopting AutoDock Vina 1.5.6（ http://vina.scripps.edu/ ）Perform molecular docking on receptor proteins. Using immunoprecipitation (IP) to detect MYH10 and α- The Interaction of SMA
metadata.instructions: File naming method: 1. Public database information, GSE43292_ GPL6244-17930.txt Probe File GSE43292_ Series_ Matrix. txt. gz Matrix file GSE57691_ GPL10558-50081. txt Probe file GSE57691_ Series_ Matrix. txt matrix file; 2. Patient age data, age. xlsx Patient age information Clinical data.xlsx Patient clinical information; 3. Detect the expression of MYH10 and SMA, 3.1 HE Docx 3.2 SMA, MYH10 immunohistochemistry 3.3 immunofluorescence image files; 4. MYH and α- Interaction of SMA, 4.1 Molecular Docking Word File 4.2 Co IP Word File; 5. Correlation between MYH and SMA, IMT, 5.1 BP xlsx file，5.2 ROC curve spv file, 5.3 cubic spline interpolation algorithm txt file. the way to read the picture data of MYH10 related pathology detection: use windows10 or above system, TXT format can be opened by text program, xlsx file can be opened by Excel, and the information of the pictures can be opened in word.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to identify key genes in clinical atherosclerosis as potential biomarkers?
Example.Answer: A data collection method used to identify key genes in clinical atherosclerosis involves DEGs screening, weighted gene co-expression network analysis, protein-protein interaction network construction and analysis, functional enrichment analysis, and GSEA analysis to obtain key atherosclerosis genes like MYH10.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the key features and methodologies involved in identifying MYH10 as a potential biomarker for clinical atherosclerosis?
Feature Specification.Answer: DEGs screening, weighted gene co-expression network analysis, protein-protein interaction networks, functional enrichment analysis, GSEA analysis, Spearman and Pearson-rho tests, ROC curve analysis, cubic spline interpolation algorithm

Quantification.Question: How many years of data were collected for the analysis of MYH10 as a potential biomarker for atherosclerosis?

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the potential outcomes on identifying key genes in atherosclerosis when using data collection methods such as DEGs screening, weighted gene co-expression network analysis, and protein-protein interaction network analysis?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Using DEGs screening, weighted gene co-expression network analysis, and protein-protein interaction network analysis can lead to the identification of key genes such as MYH10, which may serve as potential biomarkers for atherosclerosis. These methods can enhance the understanding of molecular mechanisms and relationships within the disease, potentially leading to better diagnostic and therapeutic strategies.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedural steps are involved in identifying and analyzing key genes related to atherosclerosis, such as MYH10, using DEGs screening and weighted gene co-expression network analysis?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The procedural steps include collecting and analyzing data from 2018 to 2022 to identify key genes like MYH10 using DEGs screening. This involves constructing and analyzing protein-protein interaction networks, conducting functional enrichment analysis, and performing GSEA analysis. Spearman and Pearson-rho tests are used to compare differences in intima-media thickness (IMT), MYH10, and α-SMA expression, followed by correlation analysis. ROC curve analysis determines the sensitivity and specificity of MYH10 and α-SMA in predicting atherosclerosis.
